application

Class ToServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • application.TCP
        • application.ToServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ToServer
extends TCP
    This class handles all the connections of the clients towards the server.
    Author:
    Fredrik Johansson, Matias Edin

      • ToServer

        public ToServer(java.lang.String server_ip,
        int server_port,
        java.lang.String topic,
        int nr_clients)
        This is the constructor of class ToServer witch sets up the ToServer for future connection.
        Parameters:
        server_ip - Represents the servers IP in string format.
        server_port - The server port on the server in string format.
        topic - A string with the server topic.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String nick)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Connects the client to the serve with the preferred nickname.
        Parameters:
        nick - The preferred nickname.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Throws when the super class TCP can't find the server.
        java.io.IOException - Is thrown when trying to connect or send to a server witch dosn't have an accept-socket open for incoming connection or the connection is down for sending packages.

      • receive

        public void receive(byte[] bytes,
           int bytesRead)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Is called by the super class TCP when it receives a message from the server. After receiving the bytes this method checks the OpCode of the message and depending on the code it uses different cases to interpret the message act there after.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes received from the connected server.
        bytesRead - Number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • sendPDU

        public void sendPDU(PDU pdu)
             throws java.net.SocketException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Receives a PDU and sends it through the super class TCP to the server.
        Parameters:
        pdu - The PDU to send.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(int type,
               java.lang.String text)
                 throws java.net.SocketException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        WrongCryptTypeException
        Sends a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of message.
        text - The text being sent.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        WrongCryptTypeException - Thrown when a cryptype is received with is not recognized.
